article.headline: Alabama 81, Arkansas 65
article.story: TUSCALOOSA, Ala. (AP) -- Kennedy Winston scored 25 points and Earnest Shelton added 19 to lift Alabama to a sloppy, 81-65 win over Arkansas on Wednesday night. Chuck Davis added 17 points, including seven from the free throw line, where the Crimson Tide (9-4, 1-1 Southeastern Conference) did much of its damage. Alabama went 25-for-35 from the line, sinking 19 foul shots after halftime to pull away from the Razorbacks (8-6, 0-3). The teams combined for 45 fouls -- 27 after halftime -- and 27 turnovers. Arkansas, however, was just 5-10 from the line. The Razorbacks were led by Jonathon Modica, who scored 17 points but was held to just four on 1-of-6 shooting in the second-half. Modica was not in the starting lineup for the first time this season, as coach Stan Heath went with a stronger defensive rebounding lineup. Alabama's nine first-half turnovers helped the Razorbacks lead through much of the half, but Alabama kept the game close and whittled the lead to just 35-34 at the break. The Tide opened the second period with a 3-pointer from Winston, then used a 6-0 run to forge ahead 47-39 with 14:27 left in the game. After Arkansas narrowed the lead to five on a three-point play by Vincent Hunter, neither team scored a field goal for more than three minutes. But Alabama hit nine straight free throws -- six from Davis, and three from Emmett Thomas -- to build a 58-44 lead. Kendrick Davis scored a bucket to break the Razorbacks' drought, but Winston followed with a layup and then, after a missed 3 by Arkansas, lobbed an alley-oop to Thomas, who slammed it home to put the game out of reach at 62-46. The Tide led by as many as 21. Freshman Ronnie Brewer added nine points, nine rebounds and five steals for Arkansas.
